neighbors.name: Dylan M. Alexander & Cali D. Alexander
neighbors.claims: Dylan Alexander is listed as a Kansas City, Kansas firefighter (Firefighter V) in 2022 with an annual salary of about $105,870 [GovSalaries](https://govsalaries.com/alexander-dylan-160759695). No public statements or civic roles by Dylan or Cali Alexander on development or energy issues were found in local records [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/ug-commission-overrides-mayors-veto-on-revenue-neutral-resolution-as-wyandotte-county-residents-plead-for-lower-taxes/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a trusted city official or fellow firefighter. Emphasize how the project can support local services and safety while addressing any questions one-on-one.

neighbors.name: Terry H. Mertens & Charlotte L. Mertens
neighbors.claims: Terry and Charlotte Mertens are private landowners in Wyandotte County with no record of holding any local public office or board position [Wyandotte Times](https://wyandottetimes.com/organizations/type/boards-u-s-government-appointed?char=d). No news articles or meeting minutes indicate that the Mertens have taken a public stance on development or clean energy projects [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/ug-commission-overrides-mayors-veto-on-revenue-neutral-resolution-as-wyandotte-county-residents-plead-for-lower-taxes/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in person via a mutual acquaintance or farm community contact. Show respect for their land’s legacy and explain how the project will address preservation of farmland and local heritage values.

neighbors.name: Rebecca Tanney & Jason Huston
neighbors.claims: Rebecca Tanney and Jason Huston jointly own a property in Wyandotte County, but they have no notable public profile in community affairs [Wyandotte Times](https://wyandottetimes.com/organizations/type/boards-u-s-government-appointed?char=d). No evidence was found of Tanney or Huston voicing opinions on local development or renewable energy in news or public records [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/ug-commission-overrides-mayors-veto-on-revenue-neutral-resolution-as-wyandotte-county-residents-plead-for-lower-taxes/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Invite them to a small informational meeting or open house for neighbors. Listen to any concerns about property values or neighborhood disturbance, and explain clearly how the project will maintain community quiet and protect local property values.

overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have an undetermined stance on the development (no clear support or opposition documented). None appear to wield high influence locally – they hold no public offices or leadership roles. Engagement will need to be personal and address their individual concerns.
